info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 7:26PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding resulting from excessive rainfall. * WHERE...A portion of south central Virginia, including the following counties and independent cities, City of Danville, City of Martinsville, Henry, and Pittsylvania counties. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 720 PM EDT, Heavy rainfall impacted the region earlier this afternoon and evening with parts of the advisory area receiving from 1 to 3 inches of rain, especially around Martinsville. Although the heavy rain has ended, excessive runoff from the earlier heavy rainfall could result in flooding of low-lying and flood prone areas. Small creeks and streams are also subject to sharp rises. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Bearskin Creek, Beaver Creek, Bassett Branch, Banister River and Barker Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include...D Danville... Martinsville... Chatham... Axton... Blairs... Bassett... Spencer... - For additional information on creeks, streams, rivers, and lakes, please visit our web page located at: http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Precautionary Statements: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
